definitions.definition: To rotate with a sweeping motion .
examples: She ran down the hill, windmilling her arms with glee.
The axle broke and the wheel windmilled in place briefly before careening through the wall.

subdefinitions.definition: To be rotated by the force of the fluid passing through (the propeller or turbine rotor).
labels: of a propeller or turbine rotor
subdefinitions.label_groups: intransitive , aviation , nautical , of a propeller or turbine rotor

labels: of a rotating part of a machine
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , of a rotating part of a machine

definitions.definition: To move in order to rotate the penis in a circle (similar to the rotation of a windmill).

main_definition: ( transitive , intransitive ) To rotate with a sweeping motion .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , of a rotating part of a machine ) To (become disengaged and) rotate freely .
To move in order to rotate the penis in a circle (similar to the rotation of a windmill).
